website_summaries.verdict: The buttons on this plug cover hold it into place and allow for easy release.
pros: Requires side and top pressure points to release, making it hard for a toddler to get off
Will not come off with picking or prying alone
cons: These plug covers can seem difficult to get off at times

customer_reviews.title: Hard To Remove = Good Protection
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product with My own hard earned money to protect my infant. This review contains my thoughts and experience with the product. Purchased Aug 2019 Protecting a baby from possible electrocution is very very important. Their little fingers can fit into outlets. These outlet covers are designed to be difficult to get off unlike basic insert style covers. They are difficult to get off and it even takes me a few tries to get them off holding in the buttons for the release mechanism. I have the covers in place in the babies play area and bedroom where furniture isn’t blocking an outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Bill.A

customer_reviews.title: My 10 month old can pull these out easily 😫
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because my then nine month old was easily able to remove regular plug covers. At first these seemed to solve our problem but it took my now ten month old less than two weeks to figure out how to remove these by simply pulling on them really hard. He hasn’t figured out how to press the release buttons but he doesn’t need to. He simply pulls on the outlet cover really hard and off it comes! I’m very disappointed! I will be returning and searching for another solution to prevent our curious little one from electrocuting himself!
customer_reviews.author: laura

customer_reviews.title: Beware! Lot of tiny pieces, can come apart when removing from outlet.
customer_reviews.text: When removing one of these it came apart, practically exploding in my hand and sending tiny pieces flying everywhere. I have removed several of these without incident, so I wasn't trying to force it out. In fact I had barely touched it as it fell apart. I spent all morning looking for the two tiny screws and spring so that my son wouldn't find them and choke on them. I found the spring but have yet to find the screws.
customer_reviews.author: Jia Camara

customer_reviews.title: Hard to remove - and that's a good thing
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to plug the outlets in my toddler's room for when we moved him to his big boy bed. I feel so much better about leaving him alone in his room at night with these in the wall. It requires a little bit of finagling and coordination to get them out of the outlet. But I would rather it take me a moment to remove them than for my toddler to take the out in the middle of the night.
customer_reviews.author: CBU

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love the price for a lot of covers . It’s perfect for my toddler . She’s 1 and she knows how to take out the other outlet covers that I had ( it’s easy to take out ) so I decided to get these ones because I heard it’s hard to come out & it did not disappoint. My daughter stopped trying after a few minutes after putting it in. That’s what you want , not an outlet cover that comes out easily especially if a toddler can take it out. You want one that will be hard to come out . I love the cover
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to remove, hurts my fingers
customer_reviews.text: As the previous have mentioned , yes these are very hard to remove. That is obviously the feature, but it is too hard for adults to get out! I literally hurt my thumb finger, underneath my nail trying to pull it out AND my pointer finger was super red afterwards ! It’s only $3.99 but you bet I returned this. Not worth it. Plus I realized there’s not plugs in my house that I won’t be using, I use pretty much all the plugs so this would do nothing except cover my plugs that need to be used.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Didnt lock in!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because my 2 yr old with outlandish fine motor skills can remove the regular ones...they have worked for all my 6 other kids...not this one! These looked like they would solve my issue....they didnt she just takes them out too!? I gave it 3 stars because even though she can still remove them they are bulky and far less of a choking hazard than the smaller ones I had. Back to the drawing board for a solution
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My child has taken out or eventually stood on the various kinds of outlet proofing. I have a outlet below a main window. The big box option worked for a long time, you were able to keep things plugged in. Then my child discover they could stand on it to look out the window. So I saw these and tried them. They work great, can't have anything plugged in like the last thing. But she cant pull them out like the cheap outlet covers.
customer_reviews.author: L review

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these because our 1yr old likes to mess with outlets and we had a baby gate hiding one that he always got to, so we got these and moved the gate and he is not able to pull them out, so they work great! In fact, our 9yr old bet our 15yr old that he couldn’t get it out and it was pretty difficult for him as well, haha! So I would say that these work pretty well!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Good grief NO!
customer_reviews.text: I really hate these things, so insanely hard to get out!!! I get they are to keep kids from taking out, but that is just moronic.....never could get them to come out by pressing the little 'buttons', had to force pry them out!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the baby from tripping the breakers
customer_reviews.text: My toddler is attracted to electricity. From sticking butter knives in my outlets, to climbing telephone poles, there is nothing that stops this 18 month old from catching a buzz. I've even had to take her socks away because shes wearing holes in the carpet building up static to shock the cats with. Now, these outlet covers might not solve all your problems, but they were the only thing keeping her from successfully jumping into the bath with a toaster.
customer_reviews.author: userperson

customer_reviews.title: Majorly flawed design
customer_reviews.text: Like others on here have stated, my daughter is able to remove these by simply pulling on them hard enough. The problem is that the outlet covers only lock with a catch that inserts into the ground while the 2 "hot" openings are no different than most any other outlet cover (they just sit in the holes). The problem this creates is that the top of the outlet cover can tilt out enough for fingers to grasp behind it to them have the surface area to pull hard enough to make it pop right off. So, it doesn't offer any more protection than other covers.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse P.

customer_reviews.title: Very secure!!! Almost too secure!
customer_reviews.text: Super secure from kids and maybe adults too. Almost too hard to remove. If you want something super secure and need to cover an outlet rarely used then this is perfect. I don’t use the ones I bought in every location. I put these on the outlets I know are hard to see, easy for small hands to reach and rarely used. Very secure.
customer_reviews.author: laurie pearson

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: If I hadn't thrown out the packaging would return. Installled and went to use outlet about 2 hours later, they don't pop out they should. The buttons don't release the bottom part right. Waste. I will be replacing when I go to walmart tomorrow and throwing away.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Love these and will buy again!
customer_reviews.text: I’d like to start with I gave three stars for “easy to remove”.. the whole point of these was I did not want them to be easy to remove. My child can figure out a work around for every other plug except these. They are a little difficult at first for myself to get out but once they loosen up some it is no problem and best yet, it’s been a month or so and my son still cannot get them out! Love these and will buy again. I highly recommend if you have a little who is curious and can figure out how to pull the basic plus covers.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Dame

customer_reviews.title: Definitely get these
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely worth the money as an adult it's simple and easy to put in and take out as a child they just simply cant undo it. This uses a latch to hold into the circular hole to keep It in place. Definitely get these for the kids who can easily remove the original plug covers. These are much better
customer_reviews.author: Igotzapeanut

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price
customer_reviews.text: These are great! My baby could get all of the others but this one off. They are a little harder to take in and out which is perfect for me. My baby hasn’t been able to get them out at all! I am so happy with these and will be buying more! These are only for 3 prong outlets
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Finally, an outlet cover my kid hasn't figured out!
customer_reviews.text: My son figured out how to remove the standard styles of outlet covers within a week (He was 16 months at the time). He's a fine motor fiend, well ahead of his age group. I did a lot of searching before finding these and he's now 26 months old and still hasn't figured them out. Thank goodness!!! They're literally a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: Abby K.

customer_reviews.title: They work, but woe to thee who has carpal tunnel and/or arthritis
customer_reviews.text: They are solid when plugged in and should be a deterrent to the bright and/or nimble little one. However, if you suffer from anything that weakens your grip, expect to use two hands each time you want to remove these.
customer_reviews.author: Virtualmonk

customer_reviews.title: Stays in!
customer_reviews.text: These are the only outlet cover that my 18 month cannot remove. They do take adults some working to get them off, which is good! Also the outlet needs to be flush with the cover plate for these to "grab". A little on the spendy side but you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Product works but....
customer_reviews.text: These covers do work and you do have to use some effort to remove them but I am happy with them. However, I have an issue of how the package was already opened and crumpled, an obvious return. Because they are still usable, I will keep them but it makes me wonder about the quality control of returns.
customer_reviews.author: E2Mom

customer_reviews.title: Hard to remove but worth the safety
customer_reviews.text: These are worth the extra money. Our little one figured out the basic plug in covers. These ones are more secure and harder to remove, even for me but it’s better to keep the outlets safe and covered. But the removal of them is more difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie O.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: My 1 year old was able to pull each one off with her little finger. You are supposed to push the side and top little button in then pull out. They definitely don't work. She is 1 and was able to pop them off with the tip of her finger on the top.
customer_reviews.author: chrissy

customer_reviews.title: The safest plugs!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why these don't just have straight 5 star reviews. These are the only plugs that a toddler can't just pull out. Maybe the people who have them pull out easy have different outlets with a thicker plastic around the plug or something. I have somewhat older outlets in my home and I these work great. You have to push them until you hear the click. I don't find them to be too difficult to get out either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So easy to remove, a baby could do it.
customer_reviews.text: Way TOO easy to remove. These can be pryed right out of the outlet, with little effort. Standard outlet covers work much better. Very disappointed by these.
customer_reviews.author: C-squared

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother with it
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product because my toddler seemed to take off the regular ones. This product worked just as the cheap one you buy in bulk. Didn’t stay attached to the socket like it is supposed to. My 1 1/2 year old daughter took it off without pressing the side buttons. And yes I did make sure they were in correctly but still didn’t work out.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Santiago

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: These def are hard to get out but thats the point lol they're easy to install and serve their purpose well great value for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Morris

customer_reviews.title: Great safety device for your home
customer_reviews.text: we bought this to cover the outlets in our son’s room to prevent any chances of objects being stuck into outlets. It is very easy to install and is accessible when needed. It jobs the job very well.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Very child proof
customer_reviews.text: It is great for childproofing outlets! It releases easily (not for our child) from some of our outlets and is impossible to remove from others (for our child and for us). Because of that, we have a love/hate review of the product. It is definitely effective for keeping our child safe, so that is a major WIN. For some reason they aren't always easy to remove from all of our outlets and I'm not sure why. That frustration results in us occasionally not inserting the plugs all the way so we can still use the outlet. That is obviously not an ideal situation. If you want something childproof, this is it! We are still satisfied despite the challenges.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca L Steigner

customer_reviews.title: Don't work in our outlets; These were no more difficult for our child to remove than the non-locking cheap plastic inserts.
customer_reviews.text: These plugs have a plastic hook which inserts into the ground hole where it catches the rear lip of the plastic outlet face. I can plug in and remove these without the lock engaging. I can't get the lock to engage in the outlet at all. The hook doesn't latch onto the ground hole, so it has nothing to lock onto, and slides right back out when pulled. These were no more difficult for our child to remove than the non-locking cheap plastic inserts.
customer_reviews.author: E. Klaus

customer_reviews.title: Can easily remove without even using the buttons
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to get more sophisticated plug covers since our two year old figured out how to remove our regular simple plug covers. But these did not work for us. We can easily remove without even using the buttons. Totally Ineffective.
customer_reviews.author: Kay2017

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: These are AWESOME. Keeps the 4 and 2 year olds from taking them off (unlike the normal plug covers everyone is used to) due to locking mechanism. Hard to remove (as it should be), but it’s easier after you practice. I love these so much I bought two more packs!
customer_reviews.author: Steve T.

customer_reviews.title: Best outlet plugs ever
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these. I am an early childhood teacher and I use these in my classroom. I did give only 3 stars for easy to remove because boy these suckers can be hard to remove sometimes but hello that’s the whole reason I bought them but should still be a little better way to remove them for an adult.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole7948

customer_reviews.title: Works as stated
customer_reviews.text: These are great my 1 year old cannot get em out of the wall sockets thank goodness. She's a bit of a feisty one so is able to figure stuff out super fast but this she hasn't been able to manuever and don't believe she will be able to for the next few years.
customer_reviews.author: Blushed22

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My 10 month old started pulling the regular outlet covers out so I had to get these. He is not able to pull them out. The can be a little difficult for me to get out but they're SUPPOSED to. So I'm happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Toddler Proof
customer_reviews.text: Our two year old son can get any and every outlet cover off and there is one right next to his crib and it needs to be covered. This work amazing! He is a strong kid and am impressed with these. 💯
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: I think it is better if the manufacture also makes this product with 2 legs so it can fit to all types of plug.
customer_reviews.author: Huy Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Work great and my child can’t pull them out
customer_reviews.text: Love the fact that these are so sturdy and very difficult to pull out of the outlet even for an adult. The best outlet covers I’ve found for child proofing.
customer_reviews.author: Prototype

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price not that great!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install but to remove little difficult. I wish they would have that functional button instead of just to show.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: You have to make sure and pinch all three parts to get out of outlet. All mine work amazing and toddler cant get any even bf has hard time as well. I remember reading review on these and i did experience one of my outlets (too one) to quit working not sure if it triggers something or flips switch..?
customer_reviews.author: Devan

customer_reviews.title: Much harder to get out than any other outlet plug. Great for persistent kiddos
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I first got the cheaper ones you can just peel out, and they worked ok while my kids very infants. But around the 18 month mark the little ones figured out how to get the cheap ones out. These deluxe ones are more pricey, but are very hard to get out. In fact, I rarely have success getting them out, and usually rely on my hubby. I selected a few hard to reach outlets and put in different plugs that I can get out more easily, but have these deluxe ones in most all outlets.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah E.

customer_reviews.title: Buy it now!!
customer_reviews.text: Another product that is awesome and if you watch the video from a reviewer Help shows you how to take them off and man it is the second best products that you need for sure so yes buy it and thank me later lol
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Only baby proof outlet cover
customer_reviews.text: My son loves to remove outlet covers. These are the only ones so far that he has been unable to remove.
customer_reviews.author: Brian S.

customer_reviews.title: Adultproof too
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to start baby proofing my home. Baby is almost 7 months old. Thought these ones were added security. To much added. I can not get out of my outlets now! I guess baby wont be able to either, but I do still need to use my plugs every once in a while. Good intentions just not user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: This are a really great idea. The majority of negative reviews were that they were impossible to get out again. I was actually hoping for this, as these would go in outlets I don't need access to. I could get this to snap in the outlet. Sometimes one would fit right into the bottom outlet but not the top. Honestly this is probably just the wrong type of outlet for these. For the price though they were worth a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Dae

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: The general principal of this product is sound but the execution is sloppy. This is so poorly made that it is harder to remove from a socket than the super cheap single piece covers. Even once the latch was released I needed two hands to pry it out of the socket. Furthermore the latch can be released just by pushing down on the top button, pressing the button on the side didn't seem to do anything (the top button is not supposed to move until you press the side button).
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to remove
customer_reviews.text: Too hard to remove. That may the feature but it's too hard for me to remove. Today this plug keep myself out.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: If you have a toddler that can remove covers, this one probably won’t fool them...
customer_reviews.text: I have issues removing them...my 22 month-old, however, does not and he is the reason I bought them. Sticking things in the outlet is a hobby of his.
customer_reviews.author: HappyMom

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Really good product, easy to install and remove! If you’re looking for something that’s hard to remove for a child then this is definitely it, I did a lot of research before purchasing this and this was definitely a good choice !
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Best Outlet Covers...period.
customer_reviews.text: Best outlet covers on the market by far. It was even hard for me to get off at first til I figured it out.
customer_reviews.author: Walt

customer_reviews.title: The BEST out there!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these outlet covers. They pop right in with little to no effort and are difficult even for myself to remove which is the whole point. These are the first outlet covers I've found that my very advanced for her age 2 1/2 year old cannot remove. Will definitely be ordering more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely secure, opening is virtually impossible for a baby or toddler!
customer_reviews.text: My wife hates these because she has a hard time taking them off. Which basically means my baby doesn’t stand a chance. Definitely the most secure plug covers I’ve come across.
customer_reviews.author: Vivek D

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What We Needed
customer_reviews.text: All of the outlets in our house are extremely loose in the sense that if you plugged a hair dryer in, it would fall right back out with a little tug. We bought regular outlet covers, but it took my 16 month old all of 5 minutes to come up behind me using one finger to flick them all back out of the sockets. These outlet covers literally lock onto the sockets and are near impossible to get back off which is perfect for my son. Yes, it is hard for my husband and I to take them off too, but it is worth the pain they cause if they keep my son safe.
customer_reviews.author: M. & K. Goodrich

customer_reviews.title: Hard to remove
customer_reviews.text: I really like the idea of these and my kids cant remove them but neither can I. It takes a little bit for me to be able to successfully get them out of the outlets. I thought it would be easier.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Attractive and quality product
customer_reviews.text: Great, safe product. Works better than the more expensive Bink products and just as attractive in the units. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: VPP

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use, hard to remove for a baby or little kids
customer_reviews.text: I prefer these over the traditional plug ins because with these. You actually have to push a button to remove these.
customer_reviews.author: Chris&kayla

customer_reviews.title: No key required
customer_reviews.text: These outlet plugs stay in so much better than others we’ve tried, and are still easy enough to get out. And there’s no ‘key’ to keep track of (and lose for the 50th time)
customer_reviews.author: Marian R

customer_reviews.title: I keep telling the parent that I know that this are the best
customer_reviews.text: This are the best product on the market as a child care provider I try them all and this are the best, plus the price is fear for the safety provider in this product
customer_reviews.author: Mary S Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Safety 1st fail!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item beacuse my 1 year old son figured out how to remove outlet cover. The harpoon was suposed to lock in place so to make it harder to remove. When it arrived I installed it and had my son remove it which he did within a second. Doesnt really work. Harpoon is short sonit doesnt lock in place as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Salazar

customer_reviews.title: We got these because my daughter could always pull out ...
customer_reviews.text: We got these because my daughter could always pull out the simple ones. They went in tight and there's no way she'll be able to get them out... because neither my husband nor I have been able to get them out either... hopefully we just won't ever need to use the outlets in her room...
customer_reviews.author: Maria Chappell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put in, hard to take out
customer_reviews.text: I like the look of them and they were easy to place into the outlet. I only recommend using these ones if you plan on leaving them in a long time. They are hard to remove (for adults too). Good thing is that there is no way your kid will get these out themselves.
customer_reviews.author: inkler1985

customer_reviews.title: Safety 1st
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. It can be tough at times to get the pull out of wall when you need to access the outlet. I'm very happy, keep my nephew's little fingers out of the outlet.
customer_reviews.author: A. Worley

customer_reviews.title: okay!
customer_reviews.text: They are easy to install, temporary outlet cover, but not for use where your baby has time to fiddle with it!
customer_reviews.author: amudhan

customer_reviews.title: They do the job!!
customer_reviews.text: These are not supposed to be easy to remove!!! These are the only socket protectors that my grandson has not been able to get out!!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Davis-Kearns

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: These plugs are great. Remember, the point is that its supposed to be difficult to remove. And they are. I will only use these from now on and recommend you guve them a try.
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Works for me.
customer_reviews.text: I find it hard to believe you’ll find anything at this price point to be 100% effective. With that being said, these are easily the most challenging plugs to remove that I’ve experienced. Takes a decent amount of effort for a healthy adult. Of course, this is likely dependent on the outlet itself. They will do just fine for my application. Was worth spending the money to find out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what they're supposed to do. Glad I bought these
customer_reviews.text: I seen some bad reviews complaining that these were too hard to get out. While they are right, I kinda thought that was the whole point of them. They are the only ones my 3 year old cannot get off. He is going through the (wanting to stick stuff in sockets) phase. I have caught him in too many close calls to not take it seriously. I am really glad I bought these! I would rather struggle a little to get them off then have the worse happen.
customer_reviews.author: Addicted_Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Works way better than the normal ones!
customer_reviews.text: Works way better than standard ones, I have a very smart kid and she hasn’t figured it out yet
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Nearly impossible to take off
customer_reviews.text: Hate that they’re so hard to come off but that’s the point of them. Finally something my daughter can’t take off the outlet to play with.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: better than anything I've tried
customer_reviews.text: We've gone through a lot of outlet covers in my house, and had finally settled on the Safety 1st ones that rotate (a little color spot changes from green to red) for you to pull out. My 1 year old started pulling them straight out of the wall, so we needed something tougher. These covers require you to squeeze the side and the top at the same time while pulling the cover out, so there's no way his little hands could manage it. I feel much better about these covers, and they are larger overall so less of a choking hazard as well. I wish I had found these first!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Unobtrusive and toddler-proof so far.
customer_reviews.text: Unobtrusive, and my toddler hasn't figured them out yet -- can't argue with that. They are a bit tricky to get in and out, and they require enough force that if your outlets aren't solidly mounted, they'll move about too. They do the job, but I much prefer the. I used these where the Safe Plates wouldn't fit (double gangs, for instance).
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Secure
customer_reviews.text: Hard for me to remove but hey, that just means it's that much harder for the kiddos!
customer_reviews.author: SoCali

customer_reviews.title: FRIGGIN AWESOME!!! The outlet safe cracker has been beaten.
customer_reviews.text: My son has been pulling the cheap plastic push ins and the other type w/ the button you push to pop out since 12 months. His favorite thing to play w/ is the outlets which made for lots of fits when we were constantly pulling him away from them. THIS TOOL WORKS PERFECTLY!!! Yes they are a little hard at first to get out but once you get the hang of it they are TRULY childproof. If your kid has hand strength to get these off you need to get him signed up for the sequel of Over the Top!
customer_reviews.author: Boreal

customer_reviews.title: Best safety plugs on the market for curious fingers!
customer_reviews.text: Yep. They are hard to remove until you get the hang of it - push down on the top and the sides to pull them out. It's definitely a snug fit, which is EXACTLY what we wanted. The whole goal is to defeat curious babies and toddlers, and these Safety 1st Outlet Plugs absolutely do that. If you want plug/outlet covers with peace of mind, that can't be pried enough to stick something else in the socket, remove, etc., these are the ones to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mrapunzel

customer_reviews.title: Certainly Keep Toddlers Out!
customer_reviews.text: These are some heavy-duty plug covers, which is a good thing. I have twin boys who see everything as an interesting challenge, yet they can't get these covers out of the outlet. Sure, they take a couple moments for us adults to remove, but the benefit outweighs any silly impatience one might feel while wiggling the cover out. These are so much better than the old style plug covers, which my daughter used to just pluck right out of the outlet and put in her mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Hard to remove which makes impossible for baby to remove it and that’s a purpose . We bought a lot cause we have lots of outlets . We like it
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: Impenetrable!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, these things work. NO baby can get them off. Thing is, if your outlets aren't 100% sturdy (i.e.. loose sockets), you adults will have a tough time too (because of how tightly they stick). Your best bet is to alternate: use these in your baby's primary play area and choose a more user-friendly model for the places you plug in most. (The simple ones without the release buttons.) This works for us.
customer_reviews.author: F. Beu

customer_reviews.title: Did not work!
customer_reviews.text: They did not work with our outlets. We just remodeled our house and have brand new outlets/plates. The little hook on these are not long enough to catch and lock in place with our outlets. They are pointless because our 16 month old can just pull them out like regular outlet covers.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Edridge

customer_reviews.title: Best outlet plugs available!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter was only 11 months when she figured out how to take the normal outlet plugs off. That's why we bought these plugs and in my opinion they're the best outlet plugs you can buy! I know they are difficult to get off (with a little help of a screwdriver), but first of all, our kids saftey is more important, and second, just use them for outlets you don't use or don't use a lot. For others we use outlet plates that need to be screwed on, they automatically slide back into position when the appliance is unplugged.
customer_reviews.author: hummel

customer_reviews.title: Best outlet plug ever
customer_reviews.text: Or eating on the “east to remove” because they are difficult to remove, BUT they are supposed to be and none of the kids can figure them out.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Nichols

customer_reviews.title: I like this. I should have bought more
customer_reviews.text: I like this. I should have bought more. One pack was enough to plug all the outlets in one room. Very easy to install. No forcing needed it slipped right in, and was secure.
customer_reviews.author: BadPenny

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: These work great for a kid that like to pick at things lol. My son can’t get these off unlike most other outlet covers.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: They cannot take these out. Because of these, my daughter won’t even try to take them out!
customer_reviews.author: Ivette

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The product is easy to install and not so easy to remove which I like because it insures my little ones can not remove it and harm themselves.
customer_reviews.author: dashe

customer_reviews.title: Inserts firmly into only some outlets
customer_reviews.text: These are not locking tightly in some of my outlets. It seems maybe the wall plates are too bulky and so are preventing them from being firmly inserted and locked into the outlets...if that makes sense. So my toddler will probably be able to easily remove them.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Too tough for occasional baby visits
customer_reviews.text: So hard to use! I got these for occasional use when my nephew comes over. I can't even get the one that I put in an outlet out. They are both baby proof and idiot proof, I guess. They are fine if you don't intend to use the outlet very often, or if you have Houdini Jr running around. We also have an older home, and these won't work in the two-prong outlets.
customer_reviews.author: Sara B

customer_reviews.title: Hard for toddler to remove
customer_reviews.text: These are much more challenging to remove than simple plug in outlet covers, which is the whole point of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget Toto

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt fit in all outlets due to the locking feature. I needed two hands to get the plug out, which is effective for the purpose intended. My son doesnt mess with them anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Karns

customer_reviews.title: Outlet plug that my Grandson can't get out
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good electrical outlet plug protector. It fits well and is easy to install and it's not one that my grandson can get out and hand it to me with hardly any effort. The first several times that they need to come out to use the plug are quite difficult. Once they've been in and out many times, it's not difficult for an adult to three-finger these out.
customer_reviews.author: Tennenbaum

customer_reviews.title: Good quality - would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Snug fit in sockets. Have peace of mind that it will help prevent my child from tampering with the outlets.
customer_reviews.author: J. Richards

customer_reviews.title: best plugs yet even my husband and older kids have ...
customer_reviews.text: best plugs yet even my husband and older kids have problems getting them out. I on the other hand find it easy, I do daycare and needed something the kids and babies can't pull out and choke on or not taken out to use as polly pocket tables as all the others are worthless and found in playroom most of the times if they are missing
customer_reviews.author: Murky

customer_reviews.title: A waste
customer_reviews.text: These are a waste. My 8 month can remove this
customer_reviews.author: Corin Clarke

customer_reviews.title: The best out there! Buy this product to protect your little ones.
customer_reviews.text: So far this is the best socket plugs that I've seen and used. Small ones will have trouble removing these from the outlets. I'm glad I happened to see this before purchasing the other brand.
customer_reviews.author: Eiron

customer_reviews.title: Don't Recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Good news: baby can't get them out of the socket. Bad news: I can't either. I wouldn't recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Love these! Perfect for baby and toddler!
customer_reviews.text: These have been great since my one year old started pulling out the basic plastic outlet covers. These are too difficult for my son but easy for us to remove. Exactly what we were looking for and reasonably priced!
customer_reviews.author: Clarissa Berndt

customer_reviews.title: Use a screwdriver to pull plug out
customer_reviews.text: The other reviewers were not joking...these plugs were impossible to take out. I pushed the left button with my left hand and then pushed the top button with my right hand and pulled a bit. It didnt look like the plug moved at all, but with my left hand still on the left button and holding the new "pulled" position, i inserted a screwdriver at the top to better push the plug out. Plug came off easily and I almost jumped with joy. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: NYC001

customer_reviews.title: does what is supposed to do!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little concerned about getting these after reading reviews from people who struggled getting these plugs out of the outlets. But, glad I decided to order them- they work like they should- making it difficult for little hands to pull out of the wall. Yes, they do take a little work for an adult to remove- you have to kind of wiggle them out-but it is pretty simple. Overall a great no fuss product at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: NLP

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure a toddler could pull out the cheaper plastic ones but these make us feel better. I like things that click
customer_reviews.author: Pecons

customer_reviews.title: Nice concept but too hard to take off
customer_reviews.text: The concept is nice and it secures the outlets from my little crawler, but I was struggling to take them off when using the outlets. I have to use something to pry it off.
customer_reviews.author: dacy g

customer_reviews.title: GET THEM!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely amazing. They are a pain to get out. But that’s the POINT!!! Seriously. Buy these. I have gotten multiple brands. And these are the absolute best!!! My daughter canNOT get them out. I can barely get them out haha. Get them!!!
customer_reviews.author: Karisha

product_meta.title: Safety 1st Deluxe Press Fit Outlet Plugs, 8 Count
product_meta.description: Deluxe press fit outlet plugs are specially designed to lock into outlets to help keep little fingers out, includes 8 child resistant outlet plugs.
feature_bullets: The most innovative designs and manufacturing processes
Two touch press and lock for optimum security

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars757 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
